U.S. Rep. Tim Ryan filed nominating petitions with 3,000 total signatures from voters for the Democratic nomination to the Senate.
Senate candidates running in the primary need at least 1,000 valid signatures on their nominating petitions to qualify.
Ryan, D-Howland, received signatures from voters in all 88 counties, according to his campaign.
Ryan filed his petitions Monday with the Ohio Secretary of State’s Office.
